title: VPBLENDMD/VPBLENDMQ â€” Blend Int32/Int64 Vectors Using an OpMask Control

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPBLENDMD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPBLENDMD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPBLENDMD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPBLENDMQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPBLENDMQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPBLENDMQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs an element-by-element blending of dword/qword elements between the first source operand (the second operand) and the elements of the second source operand (the third operand) using an opmask register as select control. The blended result is written into the destination.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The destination and first source operands are ZMM registers. The second source operand can be a ZMM register, a 512-bit memory location or a 512-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The opmask register is not used as a writemask for this instruction. Instead, the mask is used as an element selector: every element of the destination is conditionally selected between first source or second source using the value of the related mask bit (0 for the first source operand, 1 for the second source operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: If EVEX.z is set, the elements with corresponding mask bit value of 0 in the destination operand are zeroed.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
